citeinfo.title: Regulated Water Features - Trout Stream Special Regulations

descript.abstract: This layer shows Minnesota trout streams that have a special regulation as described in the 2013 Minnesota Fishing Regulations. Road crossings were determined using the 1991 Air Photos (1 - metre DOQs). Check the fishing regulations booklet ( http://www.dnr.state.mn.us/regulations/fishing/index.html ) for detailed information. Note legal descriptions and restrictions associated with designated trout waters under the section Special Regulations: Streams and Rivers (p. 56-62). Regulated segments are maintained as tabular data and displayed as linear events on the Stream Routes with Kittle Numbers and Mile Measures layer. In the attribute table, designated segments extend from the FROM_MEAS (mile) to the TO_MEAS (mile) and have a total length = [LENGTH_MI] on a route with total length = [ROUTE_MI].
descript.purpose: To support land use planning, watershed management, timber harvest plans, and other natural resource management activities with impact on trout streams. Also supports recreational access to trout resources.

theme.themekey: designated trout streams, special regulations, winter trout regulations, trout fishing

citeinfo.title: Designated Water Features - Trout Stream Designation Designated Water Features - Trout Stream Designation - PLS Sections Regulated Water Features - Trout Stream Winter Regulations Stream Routes with Kittle Numbers and Mile Measures

dataqual.complete: Data are completed for designated trout streams and protected tributaries statewide. However, this layer is still under review and subject to future revision. Most recent updates were completed in 2013.

procstep.procdesc:
Original source of linear features is MNDOT 1:24K Basemap features (circa 1980's). Many stream features have been re-digitized over time to match current air photos. However, feature accuracy is highly variable and may not accurately reflect real-world conditions.
Accuracy of original MNDOT Basemap features: Horizontal positional accuracy is highly variable. Rectilinear features are probably accurate to 55 feet (based on estimated production errors and a mean sum square estimation). Feature representation of sinuous streams is especially variable, with accuracies in the 55 foot range present in some areas, and non-systematic offsets (especially as coarse generalizations) present in other areas of up to 150 feet. Quality typically varies along 7 1/2 quandrangle borders, with the most significant and consistent offsets observed in the northeastern portion of the state, and the best representations found in Southern Minnesota.

attr.attrdef: Unique GIS record number for each stream route feature in DNR Hydrography SDE - Stream Route Centerlines (GIS-calculated.)

Unique Fisheries Watercourse ID for joining/linking stream routes to DNR Fisheries Stream Survey Oracle DB. FW_IDs are assigned based on how the watercourse is managed by DNR Fisheries (an FW_ID may correspond to an entire stream or portion of a stream.) Dummy (invalid) Kittle Numbers have FW_ID = 0.

Watercourse ID per DNR Fisheries Stream Survey database. A valid KITTLE_NBR has a drainage-branching format 'X-000-000-000...' (See VALID = Y, below). A dummy KITTLE_NBR has the format 'MAJXXXX-xxxxx' (See VALID = N, below).
Stream Name per DNR Fisheries Stream Survey database
Length of entire stream route in miles. (GIS-calculated.)
Mile measure for starting (downstream) location of linear feature. (GIS-calculated.)
Mile measure for ending (upstream) location of linear feature. (GIS-calculated.)
Length of linear feature in miles. (GIS-calculated.)
UTM X coordinate for starting location of linear feature. (GIS-calculated.)
UTM Y coordinate for starting location of linear feature. (GIS-calculated.)
UTM X coordinate for ending location of linear feature. (GIS-calculated.)
UTM Y coordinate for ending location of linear feature. (GIS-calculated.)
This is a numeric code representing a special regulation on that portion of stream

edom.edomvd: 12 Inch Minimum for Brook Trout, Bag Limit of 1 (Artificial Lures or Flies Only)
12 to 16 Inch Protected Slot for All Trout (Artificial Lures or Flies Only)
12 to 16 Inch Protected Slot for All Trout (Bait Allowed)
Catch & Release for All Trout (Articifial Lures or Flies Only)
Catch & Release for All Trout (Bait Allowed)
Fish Sanctuary, See Regulations for Closures
Special Limits Downstream of Posted Boundary

attr.attrdef: Date the GIS layer was published or updated and re-published.
